bill.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation of April 2017 as "National Donate Life Month".

item.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation of April 2017 as "National Donate Life Month".
A resolution expressing support for the designation of April 2017 as "National Donate Life Month".

item.name: Organ and tissue donation and transplantation

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2728; text: CR S2726)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S2728; text: CR S2726)

item.name: Introduced in Senate
item.text:
Expresses support for the goals and ideals of National Donate Life Month and for promoting awareness of organ donation.

Encourages states, localities, and the territories and possessions of the United States to issue proclamations designating April 2014 as National Donate Life Month.

Salutes individuals who have supported, promoted, and encouraged organ donation.

item.name: Passed Senate without amendment
item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses support for the goals and ideals of National Donate Life Month and for promoting awareness of organ donation.

Encourages states, localities, and the territories and possessions of the United States to issue proclamations designating April 2014 as National Donate Life Month.

Salutes individuals who have supported, promoted, and encouraged organ donation.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2728; text: CR S2726)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
